solution.text:
Surface area of a sphere of radius \(r=4\pi r^2\)
The sphere is just enclosed in a cylinder.
Therefore, the radius,\(R\) and height,\(H\) of the cylinder are \(r\) and \(2r\) respectively.
Total surface area of the cylinder\(=2\pi R(H+R)\)
Now, \(R=r\) and \(H=2r\).
Total surface area of cylinder\(=2\pi (r)(2r+r)\)
\(=2\pi \times 3r^2=6\pi r^2\)
Ratio of total surface area of sphere to that of the cylinder\(=\frac{4\pi r^2}{6\pi r^2}\)
\(=\frac23\)

content.text: The ratio of total surface area of a sphere of radius \(r\) which is just enclosed in a right circular cylinder to the total surface area of cylinder.
